kitronik_servo_lite: Blocks for driving the Kitronik Servo:Lite Board
kitronik_servo_lite.backward: Drives backwards. Call stop to stop
kitronik_servo_lite.biasDriving: Apply a bias to the wheels. 0 to 50 for left, 50 to 100 for right.
kitronik_servo_lite.driveBackwards: Drives backwards the requested distance and then stops
kitronik_servo_lite.driveForwards: Drives forwards the requested distance and then stops
kitronik_servo_lite.forward: Drives forwards. Call stop to stop
kitronik_servo_lite.left: Turns left. Call stop to stop
kitronik_servo_lite.neutral:
Sends servos to 'neutral' position.
On a well trimmed 360 this is stationary, on a normal servo this is 90 degrees.
kitronik_servo_lite.setDegreesPerSecond:
Allows the setting of the :MOVE mini turn amount.
This allows tuning for the turn x degrees commands
kitronik_servo_lite.setDegreesPerSecond|: : How many degrees per second the mini does.
kitronik_servo_lite.setDistancePerSecond:
Allows the setting of the :MOVE mini forward / reverse distance.
This allows tuning for the move x distance commands
: How many mm per second the mini does.
kitronik_servo_lite.stop:
Stop for 360 servos.
rather than write 90, which may not stop the servo moving if it is out of trim
this stops sending servo pulses, which has the same effect.
On a normal servo this will stop the servo where it is, rather than return it to neutral position.
It will also not provide any holding force.
kitronik_servo_lite.turnLeft:
Turns left through the requested degrees and then stops
needs NumberOfDegreesPerSec tuned to make accurate, as it uses
a simple turn, wait, stop method.
Runs the servos at slower than the right function to reduce wheel slip
kitronik_servo_lite.turnRight:
Turns right through the requested degrees and then stops
needs NumberOfDegreesPerSec tuned to make accurate, as it uses
a simple turn, wait, stop method.
Runs the servos at slower than the right function to reduce wheel slip
